metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39316 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. In affected versions there is an out of bound read in ZGFX decoder component of FreeRDP. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and try to decode it likely resulting in a crash. This issue has been addressed in the 2.9.0 release. Users are advised to upgrade.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39316` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> malicious server could cause client to crash

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4').
